description: If one of the user's allies chose to use Fire Pledge or Water Pledge this turn and has not moved yet, it takes its turn immediately after the user and the user's move does nothing. If combined with Water Pledge, the ally uses Grass Pledge with 150 power and a swamp appears on the target's side for 4 turns, which quarters the Speed of each Pokemon on that side. When used as a combined move, this move gains STAB no matter what the user's type is. This move does not consume the user's Grass Gem.
shortDescription: Use with Fire or Water Pledge for added effect.

description: For 5 turns, the terrain becomes Grassy Terrain. During the effect, the power of Grass-type attacks used by grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 1.3, the power of Bulldoze, Earthquake, and Magnitude used against grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 0.5, and grounded Pokemon have 1/16 of their maximum HP, rounded down, restored at the end of each turn, including the last turn. Camouflage transforms the user into a Grass type, Nature Power becomes Energy Ball, and Secret Power has a 30% chance to cause sleep. Fails if the current terrain is Grassy Terrain.

During the effect, Bounce, Fly, Flying Press, High Jump Kick, Jump Kick, Magnet Rise, Sky Drop, Splash, and Telekinesis are prevented from being used by all active Pokemon. Ground-type attacks, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Sticky Web, and the Arena Trap Ability can affect Flying types or Pokemon with the Levitate Ability. Fails if this move is already in effect.

The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

If the user leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped and still receive the healing effect. During the effect, the user can be hit normally by Ground-type attacks and be affected by Spikes, Toxic Spikes, and Sticky Web, even if the user is a Flying type or has the Levitate Ability.

shortDescription: Damages target based on Defense, not Sp. Def.

name: Psywave
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Random damage equal to 0.5x-1.5x user's level.

name: Pulverizing Pancake
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Punishment
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: 60 power +20 for each of the target's stat boosts.

name: Purify
description: The target is cured if it has a non-volatile status condition. If the target was cured, the user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down.
shortDescription: Cures target's status; heals user 1/2 max HP if so.

name: Pursuit
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: If a foe is switching out, hits it at 2x power.

name: Pyro Ball
description: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
shortDescription: 10% chance to burn the target. Thaws user.

name: Quash
description: Causes the target to take its turn after all other Pokemon this turn, no matter the priority of its selected move. Fails if the target already moved this turn.
shortDescription: Forces the target to move last this turn.

name: Quick Attack
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: Usually goes first.

name: Quick Guard
description: The user and its party members are protected from attacks with original or altered priority greater than 0 made by other Pokemon, including allies, during this turn. This move modifies the same 1/X chance of being successful used by other protection moves, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used, but does not use the chance to check for failure. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn or if this move is already in effect for the user's side.
shortDescription: Protects allies from priority attacks this turn.

name: Quiver Dance
description: Raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Raises the user's Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, Speed by 1.

name: Rage
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Raises the user's Attack by 1 if hit during use.

name: Rage Powder
description: Until the end of the turn, all single-target attacks from the opposing side are redirected to the user. Such attacks are redirected to the user before they can be reflected by Magic Coat or the Magic Bounce Ability, or drawn in by the Lightning Rod or Storm Drain Abilities. Fails if it is not a Double Battle or Battle Royal. This effect is ignored while the user is under the effect of Sky Drop.
shortDescription: The foes' moves target the user on the turn used.

name: Rain Dance
description: For 5 turns, the weather becomes Rain Dance. The damage of Water-type attacks is multiplied by 1.5 and the damage of Fire-type attacks is multiplied by 0.5 during the effect. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Damp Rock. Fails if the current weather is Rain Dance.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, heavy rain powers Water moves.

name: Rapid Spin
description: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the effects of Leech Seed and binding moves end for the user, and all hazards are removed from the user's side of the field. Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Free user from hazards/bind/Leech Seed; +1 Spe.

name: Razor Leaf
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
shortDescription: High critical hit ratio. Hits adjacent foes.

name: Razor Shell
description: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1.

name: Razor Wind
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Charges, then hits foe(s) turn 2. High crit ratio.

name: Recover
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half up.
shortDescription: Heals the user by 50% of its max HP.

name: Recycle
description: The user regains the item it last used. Fails if the user is holding an item, if the user has not held an item, if the item was a popped Air Balloon, if the item was picked up by a Pokemon with the Pickup Ability, or if the item was lost to Bug Bite, Corrosive Gas, Covet, Incinerate, Knock Off, Pluck, or Thief. Items thrown with Fling can be regained.
shortDescription: Restores the item the user last used.

name: Reflect
description: For 5 turns, the user and its party members take 0.5x damage from physical attacks, or 0.66x damage if in a Double Battle. Damage is not reduced further with Aurora Veil. Critical hits ignore this effect. It is removed from the user's side if the user or an ally is successfully hit by Brick Break, Psychic Fangs, or Defog. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Light Clay. Fails if the effect is already active on the user's side.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, physical damage to allies is halved.

name: Reflect Type
description: Causes the user's types to become the same as the current types of the target. If the target's current types include typeless and a non-added type, typeless is ignored. If the target's current types include typeless and an added type from Forest's Curse or Trick-or-Treat, typeless is copied as the Normal type instead. Fails if the user is an Arceus or a Silvally, or if the target's current type is typeless alone.
shortDescription: User becomes the same type as the target.

name: Refresh
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: User cures its burn, poison, or paralysis.

name: Relic Song
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: 10% chance to sleep foe(s). Meloetta transforms.

name: Rest
description: The user falls asleep for the next two turns and restores all of its HP, curing itself of any non-volatile status condition in the process. Fails if the user has full HP, is already asleep, or if another effect is preventing sleep.
shortDescription: User sleeps 2 turns and restores HP and status.

name: Retaliate
description: Power doubles if one of the user's party members fainted last turn.
shortDescription: Power doubles if an ally fainted last turn.

name: Return
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Max 102 power at maximum Happiness.

name: Revelation Dance
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Type varies based on the user's primary type.

name: Revenge
description: Power doubles if the user was hit by the target this turn.
shortDescription: Power doubles if user is damaged by the target.

name: Reversal
description: The power of this move is 20 if X is 33 to 48, 40 if X is 17 to 32, 80 if X is 10 to 16, 100 if X is 5 to 9, 150 if X is 2 to 4, and 200 if X is 0 or 1, where X is equal to (user's current HP * 48 / user's maximum HP), rounded down.
shortDescription: More power the less HP the user has left.

name: Rising Voltage
description: If the current terrain is Electric Terrain and the target is grounded, this move's power is doubled.
shortDescription: 2x power if target is grounded in Electric Terrain.

name: Roar
description: The target is forced to switch out and be replaced with a random unfainted ally. Fails if the target is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party, or if the target used Ingrain previously or has the Suction Cups Ability.
shortDescription: Forces the target to switch to a random ally.

name: Roar of Time
description: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.
shortDescription: User cannot move next turn.

name: Rock Blast

shortDescription: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

name: Rock Climb

Fails if the user's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Ice Face, Multitype, Power Construct, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Zen Mode, or already matches the target, or if the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Disguise, Flower Gift, Forecast, Gulp Missile, Hunger Switch, Ice Face, Illusion, Imposter, Multitype, Neutralizing Gas, Power Construct, Power of Alchemy, Receiver, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Trace, Wonder Guard, or Zen Mode.

name: Rollout
description: If this move is successful, the user is locked into this move and cannot make another move until it misses, 5 turns have passed, or the attack cannot be used. Power doubles with each successful hit of this move and doubles again if Defense Curl was used previously by the user. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn. If this move hits an active Disguise during the effect, the power multiplier is paused but the turn counter is not, potentially allowing the multiplier to be used on the user's next move after this effect ends.
shortDescription: Power doubles with each hit. Repeats for 5 turns.

name: Roost
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half up. Until the end of the turn, Flying-type users lose their Flying type and pure Flying-type users become Normal type. Does nothing if the user's HP is full.
shortDescription: Heals 50% HP. Flying-type removed 'til turn ends.

name: Rototiller

name: Round

Pokemon on the user's side cannot become affected by Yawn but can fall asleep from its effect. It is removed from the user's side if the user or an ally is successfully hit by Defog. name: Sand Attack

name: Sandstorm
description: For 5 turns, the weather becomes Sandstorm. At the end of each turn except the last, all active Pokemon lose 1/16 of their maximum HP, rounded down, unless they are a Ground, Rock, or Steel type, or have the Magic Guard, Overcoat, Sand Force, Sand Rush, or Sand Veil Abilities. During the effect, the Special Defense of Rock-type Pokemon is multiplied by 1.5 when taking damage from a special attack. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Smooth Rock. Fails if the current weather is Sandstorm.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, a sandstorm rages. Rock: 1.5x SpD.

name: Sand Tomb
description: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

If the target's side is protected by Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard, that protection is also broken for this turn and other Pokemon may attack the target's side normally. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

name: Sheer Cold
description: Deals damage to the target equal to the target's maximum HP. Ignores accuracy and evasiveness modifiers. This attack's accuracy is equal to (user's level - target's level + X)%, where X is 30 if the user is an Ice type and 20 otherwise, and fails if the target is at a higher level. Ice-type Pokemon and Pokemon with the Sturdy Ability are immune.

name: Shell Side Arm
description: Has a 20% chance to poison the target. This move becomes a physical attack that makes contact if the value of ((((2 * the user's level / 5 + 2) * 90 * X) / Y) / 50), where X is the user's Attack stat and Y is the target's Defense stat, is greater than the same value where X is the user's Special Attack stat and Y is the target's Special Defense stat. No stat modifiers other than stat stage changes are considered for this purpose. If the two values are equal, this move chooses a damage category at random.
shortDescription: 20% psn. Physical+contact if it would be stronger.

name: Shell Smash
description: Lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage. Raises the user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by 2 stages.

name: Shell Trap

If the user was hit and has not fainted, it attacks immediately after being hit, and the effect ends. If the opponent's physical attack had a secondary effect removed by the Sheer Force Ability, it does not count for the purposes of this effect.

This move cannot select Assist, Beak Blast, Belch, Bide, Celebrate, Chatter, Copycat, Dynamax Cannon, Focus Punch, Hold Hands, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Shell Trap, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, Uproar, any two-turn move, or any Max Move.

During the effect, Magnet Rise fails for the target and Telekinesis fails against the target.

Opponents lose 1/8 of their maximum HP with one layer, 1/6 of their maximum HP with two layers, and 1/4 of their maximum HP with three layers, all rounded down. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Rapid Spin or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.

name: Spiky Shield
description: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn, and Pokemon making contact with the user lose 1/8 of their maximum HP, rounded down. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped. The effect ends if the user leaves the field.

name: Spit Up

name: Splintered Stormshards
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Ends the effects of terrain.

name: Spore
description: Causes the target to fall asleep.
shortDescription: Causes the target to fall asleep.

name: Spotlight
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Target's foes' moves are redirected to it this turn.

name: Stealth Rock
description: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, damaging each opposing Pokemon that switches in. Fails if the effect is already active on the opposing side. Foes lose 1/32, 1/16, 1/8, 1/4, or 1/2 of their maximum HP, rounded down, based on their weakness to the Rock type; 0.25x, 0.5x, neutral, 2x, or 4x, respectively. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Rapid Spin or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.
shortDescription: Hurts foes on switch-in. Factors Rock weakness.

name: Steam Eruption
description: Has a 30% chance to burn the target. The target thaws out if it is frozen.
shortDescription: 30% chance to burn the target. Thaws target.

name: Steamroller
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

name: Steel Beam
description: Whether or not this move is successful and even if it would cause fainting, the user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded up, unless the user has the Magic Guard Ability.
shortDescription: User loses 50% max HP.

name: Steel Roller
description: Fails if there is no terrain active. Ends the effects of Electric Terrain, Grassy Terrain, Misty Terrain, and Psychic Terrain.
shortDescription: Fails if there is no terrain active. Ends the terrain.

name: Steel Wing
description: Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 10% chance to raise the user's Defense by 1.

name: Sticky Web
description: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, lowering the Speed by 1 stage of each opposing Pokemon that switches in, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon or has the Levitate Ability. Fails if the effect is already active on the opposing side. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Rapid Spin or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.
shortDescription: Lowers Speed of grounded foes by 1 on switch-in.

name: Stockpile
description: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage. The user's Stockpile count increases by 1. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 3. The user's Stockpile count is reset to 0 when it is no longer active.
shortDescription: Raises user's Defense, Sp. Def by 1. Max 3 uses.

name: Stoked Sparksurfer
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: 100% chance to paralyze the target.

name: Stomp
description: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.
shortDescription: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

name: Stomping Tantrum
description: Power doubles if the user's last move on the previous turn, including moves called by other moves or those used through Instruct, Magic Coat, Snatch, or the Dancer or Magic Bounce Abilities, failed to do any of its normal effects, not including damage from an unsuccessful High Jump Kick, Jump Kick, or Mind Blown, or if the user was prevented from moving by any effect other than recharging or Sky Drop. A move that was blocked by Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, Spiky Shield, Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard will not double this move's power, nor will Bounce or Fly ending early due to the effect of Gravity, Smack Down, or Thousand Arrows.
shortDescription: Power doubles if the user's last move failed.

name: Stone Edge
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
shortDescription: High critical hit ratio.

name: Stored Power
description: Power is equal to 20+(X*20), where X is the user's total stat stage changes that are greater than 0.
shortDescription: + 20 power for each of the user's stat boosts.

name: Storm Throw
description: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.
shortDescription: Always results in a critical hit.

name: Strange Steam
description: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.
shortDescription: 20% chance to confuse the target.

name: Strength
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Strength Sap
description: Lowers the target's Attack by 1 stage. The user restores its HP equal to the target's Attack stat calculated with its stat stage before this move was used. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down. Fails if the target's Attack stat stage is -6.
shortDescription: User heals HP=target's Atk stat. Lowers Atk by 1.

name: String Shot
description: Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.
shortDescription: Lowers the foe(s) Speed by 2.

name: Struggle
description: Deals typeless damage to a random opposing Pokemon. If this move was successful, the user loses 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded half up, and the Rock Head Ability does not prevent this. This move is automatically used if none of the user's known moves can be selected.
shortDescription: User loses 1/4 of its max HP.

name: Struggle Bug
description: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 100% chance to lower the foe(s) Sp. Atk by 1.

name: Stuff Cheeks
description: This move cannot be selected unless the user is holding a Berry. The user eats its Berry and raises its Defense by 2 stages. This effect is not prevented by the Klutz or Unnerve Abilities, or the effects of Embargo or Magic Room. Fails if the user is not holding a Berry.
shortDescription: Must hold Berry to use. User eats Berry, Def +2.

name: Stun Spore
description: Paralyzes the target.
shortDescription: Paralyzes the target.

name: Submission
description: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: Has 1/4 recoil.

name: Substitute
description: The user takes 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, and puts it into a substitute to take its place in battle. The substitute is removed once enough damage is inflicted on it, or if the user switches out or faints. Baton Pass can be used to transfer the substitute to an ally, and the substitute will keep its remaining HP. Until the substitute is broken, it receives damage from all attacks made by other Pokemon and shields the user from status effects and stat stage changes caused by other Pokemon. Sound-based moves and Pokemon with the Infiltrator Ability ignore substitutes. The user still takes normal damage from weather and status effects while behind its substitute. If the substitute breaks during a multi-hit attack, the user will take damage from any remaining hits. If a substitute is created while the user is trapped by a binding move, the binding effect ends immediately. Fails if the user does not have enough HP remaining to create a substitute without fainting, or if it already has a substitute.
shortDescription: User takes 1/4 its max HP to put in a substitute.

name: Subzero Slammer
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

name: Sucker Punch
description: Fails if the target did not select a physical attack, special attack, or Me First for use this turn, or if the target moves before the user.
shortDescription: Usually goes first. Fails if target is not attacking.

name: Sunny Day
description: For 5 turns, the weather becomes Sunny Day. The damage of Fire-type attacks is multiplied by 1.5 and the damage of Water-type attacks is multiplied by 0.5 during the effect. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Heat Rock. Fails if the current weather is Sunny Day.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, intense sunlight powers Fire moves.

name: Sunsteel Strike
description: This move and its effects ignore the Abilities of other Pokemon.
shortDescription: Ignores the Abilities of other Pokemon.

name: Super Fang
description: Deals damage to the target equal to half of its current HP, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: Does damage equal to 1/2 target's current HP.

name: Superpower
description: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1.

name: Supersonic
description: Causes the target to become confused.
shortDescription: Causes the target to become confused.

name: Supersonic Skystrike
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

name: Surf
description: Damage doubles if the target is using Dive.
shortDescription: Hits adjacent Pokemon. Double damage on Dive.

name: Surging Strikes
description: Hits three times. This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.
shortDescription: Always results in a critical hit. Hits 3 times.

name: Swagger
description: Raises the target's Attack by 2 stages and confuses it.
shortDescription: Raises the target's Attack by 2 and confuses it.

name: Swallow
description: The user restores its HP based on its Stockpile count. Restores 1/4 of its maximum HP if it's 1, 1/2 of its maximum HP if it's 2, both rounded half down, and all of its HP if it's 3. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 0. The user's Defense and Special Defense decrease by as many stages as Stockpile had increased them, and the user's Stockpile count resets to 0.
shortDescription: Heals the user based on uses of Stockpile.

name: Sweet Kiss
description: Causes the target to become confused.
shortDescription: Causes the target to become confused.

name: Sweet Scent
description: Lowers the target's evasiveness by 2 stages.
shortDescription: Lowers the foe(s) evasiveness by 2.

name: Swift
description: This move does not check accuracy.
shortDescription: This move does not check accuracy. Hits foes.

name: Switcheroo
description: The user swaps its held item with the target's held item. Fails if either the user or the target is holding a Mail or Z-Crystal, if neither is holding an item, if the user is trying to give or take a Mega Stone to or from the species that can Mega Evolve with it, or if the user is trying to give or take a Blue Orb, a Red Orb, a Griseous Orb, a Plate, a Drive, or a Memory to or from a Kyogre, a Groudon, a Giratina, an Arceus, a Genesect, or a Silvally, respectively. The target is immune to this move if it has the Sticky Hold Ability.
shortDescription: User switches its held item with the target's.

name: Swords Dance
description: Raises the user's Attack by 2 stages.
shortDescription: Raises the user's Attack by 2.

name: Synchronoise
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Hits adjacent Pokemon sharing the user's type.

name: Synthesis
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP if Delta Stream or no weather conditions are in effect or if the user is holding Utility Umbrella, 2/3 of its maximum HP if the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, and 1/4 of its maximum HP if the weather is Hail, Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, or Sandstorm, all rounded half down.
shortDescription: Heals the user by a weather-dependent amount.

name: Tackle
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Tail Glow
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Raises the user's Sp. Atk by 3.

name: Tail Slap
description: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.
shortDescription: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

name: Tail Whip
description: Lowers the target's Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Lowers the foe(s) Defense by 1.

name: Tailwind
description: For 4 turns, the user and its party members have their Speed doubled. Fails if this move is already in effect for the user's side.
shortDescription: For 4 turns, allies' Speed is doubled.

name: Take Down
description: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: Has 1/4 recoil.

name: Tar Shot
description: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 stage. Until the target switches out, the effectiveness of Fire-type moves is doubled against it.
shortDescription: Target gets -1 Spe and becomes weaker to Fire.

name: Taunt
description: Prevents the target from using non-damaging moves for its next three turns. Pokemon with the Oblivious Ability or protected by the Aroma Veil Ability are immune.
shortDescription: Target can't use status moves its next 3 turns.

name: Tearful Look
description: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk by 1.

name: Teatime
description: All active Pokemon consume their held Berries. This effect is not prevented by substitutes, the Klutz or Unnerve Abilities, or the effects of Embargo or Magic Room. Fails if no active Pokemon is holding a Berry.
shortDescription: All active Pokemon consume held Berries.

name: Techno Blast
description: This move's type depends on the user's held Drive.
shortDescription: Type varies based on the held Drive.

name: Tectonic Rage
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

name: Teeter Dance
description: Causes the target to become confused.
shortDescription: Confuses adjacent Pokemon.

name: Telekinesis
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: For 3 turns, target floats but moves can't miss it.

name: Teleport
description: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members.
shortDescription: User switches out.

name: Terrain Pulse
description: Power doubles if the user is grounded and a terrain is active, and this move's type changes to match. Electric type during Electric Terrain, Grass type during Grassy Terrain, Fairy type during Misty Terrain, and Psychic type during Psychic Terrain.
shortDescription: User on terrain: power doubles, type varies.

name: Thief
description: If this attack was successful and the user has not fainted, it steals the target's held item if the user is not holding one. The target's item is not stolen if it is a Mail or Z-Crystal, or if the target is a Kyogre holding a Blue Orb, a Groudon holding a Red Orb, a Giratina holding a Griseous Orb, an Arceus holding a Plate, a Genesect holding a Drive, a Silvally holding a Memory, or a Pokemon that can Mega Evolve holding the Mega Stone for its species. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle or the Harvest Ability.
shortDescription: If the user has no item, it steals the target's.

name: Thousand Arrows
description: This move can hit airborne Pokemon, which includes Flying-type Pokemon, Pokemon with the Levitate Ability, Pokemon holding an Air Balloon, and Pokemon under the effect of Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. If the target is a Flying type and is not already grounded, this move deals neutral damage regardless of its other type(s). This move can hit a target using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop. If this move hits a target under the effect of Bounce, Fly, Magnet Rise, or Telekinesis, the effect ends. If the target is a Flying type that has not used Roost this turn or a Pokemon with the Levitate Ability, it loses its immunity to Ground-type attacks and the Arena Trap Ability as long as it remains active. During the effect, Magnet Rise fails for the target and Telekinesis fails against the target.
shortDescription: Grounds adjacent foes. First hit neutral on Flying.

name: Thousand Waves
description: Prevents the target from switching out. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped. The effect ends if the user leaves the field.
shortDescription: Hits adjacent foes. Prevents them from switching.

name: Thrash
description: The user spends two or three turns locked into this move and becomes confused immediately after its move on the last turn of the effect if it is not already. This move targets an opposing Pokemon at random on each turn. If the user is prevented from moving, is asleep at the beginning of a turn, or the attack is not successful against the target on the first turn of the effect or the second turn of a three-turn effect, the effect ends without causing confusion. If this move is called by Sleep Talk and the user is asleep, the move is used for one turn and does not confuse the user.
shortDescription: Lasts 2-3 turns. Confuses the user afterwards.

name: Throat Chop
description: For 2 turns, the target cannot use sound-based moves.
shortDescription: For 2 turns, the target cannot use sound moves.

name: Thunder
description: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target. This move can hit a target using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop. If the weather is Primordial Sea or Rain Dance, this move does not check accuracy. If the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, this move's accuracy is 50%. If this move is used against a Pokemon holding Utility Umbrella, this move's accuracy remains at 70%.
shortDescription: 30% chance to paralyze. Can't miss in rain.

name: Thunderbolt
description: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
shortDescription: 10% chance to paralyze the target.

name: Thunder Cage
description: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
shortDescription: Traps and damages the target for 4-5 turns.

name: Thunder Fang
description: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target and a 10% chance to make it flinch.
shortDescription: 10% chance to paralyze. 10% chance to flinch.

name: Thunderous Kick
description: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 100% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1.

name: Thunder Punch
description: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
shortDescription: 10% chance to paralyze the target.

name: Thunder Shock
description: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
shortDescription: 10% chance to paralyze the target.

name: Thunder Wave
description: Paralyzes the target. This move does not ignore type immunity.
shortDescription: Paralyzes the target.

name: Tickle
description: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by 1.

name: Topsy-Turvy
description: The target's positive stat stages become negative and vice versa. Fails if all of the target's stat stages are 0.
shortDescription: Inverts the target's stat stages.

name: Torment
description: Prevents the target from selecting the same move for use two turns in a row. This effect ends when the target is no longer active.
shortDescription: Target can't select the same move twice in a row.

name: Toxic
description: Badly poisons the target. If a Poison-type Pokemon uses this move, the target cannot avoid the attack, even if the target is in the middle of a two-turn move.
shortDescription: Badly poisons the target. Poison types can't miss.

name: Toxic Spikes
description: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, poisoning each opposing Pokemon that switches in, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon or has the Levitate Ability. Can be used up to two times before failing. Opposing Pokemon become poisoned with one layer and badly poisoned with two layers. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Rapid Spin or Defog successfully, is hit by Defog, or a grounded Poison-type Pokemon switches in. Safeguard prevents the opposing party from being poisoned on switch-in, but a substitute does not.
shortDescription: Poisons grounded foes on switch-in. Max 2 layers.

name: Toxic Thread
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 and poisons it.

name: Transform
description: The user transforms into the target. The target's current stats, stat stages, types, moves, Ability, weight, gender, and sprite are copied. The user's level and HP remain the same and each copied move receives only 5 PP, with a maximum of 5 PP each. The user can no longer change formes if it would have the ability to do so. This move fails if it hits a substitute, if either the user or the target is already transformed, or if either is behind an Illusion.
shortDescription: Copies target's stats, moves, types, and Ability.

name: Tri Attack
description: Has a 20% chance to either burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.
shortDescription: 20% chance to paralyze or burn or freeze target.

name: Trick
description: The user swaps its held item with the target's held item. Fails if either the user or the target is holding a Mail or Z-Crystal, if neither is holding an item, if the user is trying to give or take a Mega Stone to or from the species that can Mega Evolve with it, or if the user is trying to give or take a Blue Orb, a Red Orb, a Griseous Orb, a Plate, a Drive, or a Memory to or from a Kyogre, a Groudon, a Giratina, an Arceus, a Genesect, or a Silvally, respectively. The target is immune to this move if it has the Sticky Hold Ability.
shortDescription: User switches its held item with the target's.

name: Trick-or-Treat
description: Causes the Ghost type to be added to the target, effectively making it have two or three types. Fails if the target is already a Ghost type. If Forest's Curse adds a type to the target, it replaces the type added by this move and vice versa.
shortDescription: Adds Ghost to the target's type(s).

name: Trick Room
description: For 5 turns, the Speed of every Pokemon is recalculated for the purposes of determining turn order. During the effect, each Pokemon's Speed is considered to be (10000 - its normal Speed), and if this value is greater than 8191, 8192 is subtracted from it. If this move is used during the effect, the effect ends.
shortDescription: Goes last. For 5 turns, turn order is reversed.

name: Triple Axel
description: Hits three times. Power increases to 40 for the second hit and 60 for the third. This move checks accuracy for each hit, and the attack ends if the target avoids a hit. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit three times.
shortDescription: Hits 3 times. Each hit can miss, but power rises.

name: Triple Kick
description: Hits three times. Power increases to 20 for the second hit and 30 for the third. This move checks accuracy for each hit, and the attack ends if the target avoids a hit. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit three times.
shortDescription: Hits 3 times. Each hit can miss, but power rises.

name: Trop Kick
description: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 100% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1.

name: Trump Card
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: More power the fewer PP this move has left.

name: Twineedle
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Hits 2 times. Each hit has 20% chance to poison.

name: Twinkle Tackle
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

name: Twister
description: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch. Power doubles if the target is using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop.
shortDescription: 20% chance to make the foe(s) flinch.

name: U-turn
description: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members, or if the target switched out using an Eject Button or through the effect of the Emergency Exit or Wimp Out Abilities.
shortDescription: User switches out after damaging the target.

name: Uproar
description: The user spends three turns locked into this move. This move targets an opponent at random on each turn. On the first of the three turns, all sleeping active Pokemon wake up. During the three turns, no active Pokemon can fall asleep by any means, and Pokemon switched in during the effect do not wake up. If the user is prevented from moving or the attack is not successful against the target during one of the turns, the effect ends.
shortDescription: Lasts 3 turns. Active Pokemon cannot fall asleep.

name: Vacuum Wave
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: Usually goes first.

name: V-create
description: Lowers the user's Speed, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Lowers the user's Defense, Sp. Def, Speed by 1.

name: Venom Drench
description: Lowers the target's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by 1 stage if the target is poisoned. Fails if the target is not poisoned.
shortDescription: Lowers Atk/Sp. Atk/Speed of poisoned foes by 1.

name: Venoshock
description: Power doubles if the target is poisoned.
shortDescription: Power doubles if the target is poisoned.

name: Vine Whip
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Vise Grip
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Vital Throw
description: This move does not check accuracy.
shortDescription: This move does not check accuracy. Goes last.

name: Volt Switch
description: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members, or if the target switched out using an Eject Button or through the effect of the Emergency Exit or Wimp Out Abilities.
shortDescription: User switches out after damaging the target.

name: Volt Tackle
description: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target. If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: Has 33% recoil. 10% chance to paralyze target.

name: Wake-Up Slap
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: Power doubles if target is asleep, and wakes it.

name: Waterfall
description: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
shortDescription: 20% chance to make the target flinch.

name: Water Gun
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Water Pledge
description: If one of the user's allies chose to use Fire Pledge or Grass Pledge this turn and has not moved yet, it takes its turn immediately after the user and the user's move does nothing. If combined with Fire Pledge, the ally uses Water Pledge with 150 power and a rainbow appears on the user's side for 4 turns, which doubles secondary effect chances and stacks with the Serene Grace Ability, except effects that cause flinching can only have their chance doubled once. If combined with Grass Pledge, the ally uses Grass Pledge with 150 power and a swamp appears on the target's side for 4 turns, which quarters the Speed of each Pokemon on that side. When used as a combined move, this move gains STAB no matter what the user's type is. This move does not consume the user's Water Gem, and cannot be redirected by the Storm Drain Ability.
shortDescription: Use with Grass or Fire Pledge for added effect.

name: Water Pulse
description: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.
shortDescription: 20% chance to confuse the target.

name: Water Shuriken
description: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the user is an Ash-Greninja with the Battle Bond Ability, this move has a power of 20 and always hits three times.
shortDescription: Usually goes first. Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

name: Water Sport
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: For 5 turns, Fire-type attacks have 1/3 power.

name: Water Spout
description: Power is equal to (user's current HP * 150 / user's maximum HP), rounded down, but not less than 1.
shortDescription: Less power as user's HP decreases. Hits foe(s).

name: Weather Ball
description: Power doubles if a weather condition other than Delta Stream is active, and this move's type changes to match. Ice type during Hail, Water type during Primordial Sea or Rain Dance, Rock type during Sandstorm, and Fire type during Desolate Land or Sunny Day. If the user is holding Utility Umbrella and uses Weather Ball during Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, Desolate Land, or Sunny Day, the move is still Normal-type and does not have a base power boost.
shortDescription: Power doubles and type varies in each weather.

name: Whirlpool
description: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
shortDescription: Traps and damages the target for 4-5 turns.

name: Whirlwind
description: The target is forced to switch out and be replaced with a random unfainted ally. Fails if the target is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party, or if the target used Ingrain previously or has the Suction Cups Ability.
shortDescription: Forces the target to switch to a random ally.

name: Wicked Blow
description: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.
shortDescription: Always results in a critical hit.

name: Wide Guard
description: The user and its party members are protected from moves made by other Pokemon, including allies, during this turn that target all adjacent foes or all adjacent Pokemon. This move modifies the same 1/X chance of being successful used by other protection moves, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used, but does not use the chance to check for failure. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn or if this move is already in effect for the user's side.
shortDescription: Protects allies from multi-target moves this turn.

name: Wild Charge
description: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: Has 1/4 recoil.

name: Will-O-Wisp
description: Burns the target.
shortDescription: Burns the target.

name: Wing Attack
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Wish
description: At the end of the next turn, the Pokemon at the user's position has 1/2 of the user's maximum HP restored to it, rounded down. Fails if this move is already in effect for the user's position.
shortDescription: Next turn, 50% of the user's max HP is restored.

name: Withdraw
description: Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Raises the user's Defense by 1.

name: Wonder Room
description: For 5 turns, all active Pokemon have their Defense and Special Defense stats swapped. Stat stage changes are unaffected. If this move is used during the effect, the effect ends.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, all Defense and Sp. Def stats switch.

name: Wood Hammer
description: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: Has 33% recoil.

name: Work Up
description: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Raises the user's Attack and Sp. Atk by 1.

name: Worry Seed
description: Causes the target's Ability to become Insomnia. Fails if the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Ice Face, Insomnia, Multitype, Power Construct, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Truant, or Zen Mode.
shortDescription: The target's Ability becomes Insomnia.

name: Wrap
description: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
shortDescription: Traps and damages the target for 4-5 turns.

name: Wring Out
description: Not available in gen 8
shortDescription: More power the more HP the target has left.

name: X-Scissor
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Yawn
description: Causes the target to fall asleep at the end of the next turn. Fails when used if the target cannot fall asleep or if it already has a non-volatile status condition. At the end of the next turn, if the target is still active, does not have a non-volatile status condition, and can fall asleep, it falls asleep. If the target becomes affected, this effect cannot be prevented by Safeguard or a substitute, or by falling asleep and waking up during the effect.
shortDescription: Puts the target to sleep after 1 turn.

name: Zap Cannon
description: Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.
shortDescription: 100% chance to paralyze the target.

name: Zen Headbutt
description: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
shortDescription: 20% chance to make the target flinch.

name: Zing Zap
description: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
shortDescription: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

name: Anchor Shot
description: Prevents the target from switching out. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Parting Shot, U-turn, or Volt Switch. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped. The effect ends if the user leaves the field.

name: Assist
description: A random move among those known by the user's party members is selected for use. Does not select Assist, Baneful Bunker, Beak Blast, Belch, Bestow, Bounce, Celebrate, Chatter, Circle Throw, Copycat, Counter, Covet, Destiny Bond, Detect, Dig, Dive, Dragon Tail, Endure, Feint, Fly, Focus Punch, Follow Me, Helping Hand, Hold Hands, King's Shield, Mat Block, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Coat, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Phantom Force, Protect, Rage Powder, Roar, Shadow Force, Shell Trap, Sketch, Sky Drop, Sleep Talk, Snatch, Spiky Shield, Spotlight, Struggle, Switcheroo, Thief, Transform, Trick, Whirlwind, or any Z-Move.
shortDescription: Uses a random move known by a team member.

name: Baneful Bunker
description: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn, and Pokemon making contact with the user become poisoned. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Protect, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

name: Barrage
description: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.
shortDescription: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

name: Barrier
description: Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.

name: Bestow
description: The target receives the user's held item. Fails if the user has no item or is holding a Mail or Z-Crystal, if the target is already holding an item, if the user is a Kyogre holding a Blue Orb, a Groudon holding a Red Orb, a Giratina holding a Griseous Orb, an Arceus holding a Plate, a Genesect holding a Drive, a Silvally holding a Memory, a Pokemon that can Mega Evolve holding the Mega Stone for its species, or if the target is one of those Pokemon and the user is holding the respective item.

name: Bide
description: The user spends two turns locked into this move and then, on the second turn after using this move, the user attacks the last Pokemon that hit it, inflicting double the damage in HP it lost to attacks during the two turns. If the last Pokemon that hit it is no longer active, the user attacks a random opposing Pokemon instead. If the user is prevented from moving during this move's use, the effect ends. This move does not check accuracy and does not ignore type immunity.
shortDescription: Waits 2 turns; deals double the damage taken.

name: Bind
description: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Parting Shot, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

name: Block

If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped. The effect ends if the user leaves the field.

Normal type on the regular Wi-Fi terrain, Electric type during Electric Terrain, Fairy type during Misty Terrain, Grass type during Grassy Terrain, and Psychic type during Psychic Terrain. Fails if the user's type cannot be changed or if the user is already purely that type.

name: Chatter
description: Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.
shortDescription: 100% chance to confuse the target.

name: Chip Away

description: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Parting Shot, U-turn, or Volt Switch. Fails if no move has been used, or if the last move used was Assist, Baneful Bunker, Beak Blast, Belch, Bestow, Celebrate, Chatter, Circle Throw, Copycat, Counter, Covet, Crafty Shield, Destiny Bond, Detect, Dragon Tail, Endure, Feint, Focus Punch, Follow Me, Helping Hand, Hold Hands, King's Shield, Mat Block, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Coat, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Protect, Rage Powder, Roar, Shell Trap, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Snatch, Spiky Shield, Spotlight, Struggle, Switcheroo, Thief, Transform, Trick, Whirlwind, or any Z-Move.

If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain under this effect. If the target's Ability is Battle Bond, Comatose, Disguise, Multitype, Power Construct, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, or Zen Mode, this effect does not happen, and receiving the effect through Baton Pass ends the effect immediately.

name: Dark Void
description: Causes the target to fall asleep. This move cannot be used successfully unless the user's current form, while considering Transform, is Darkrai.

name: Defog

If this move is successful and whether or not the target's evasiveness was affected, the effects of Reflect, Light Screen, Aurora Veil, Safeguard, Mist, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Stealth Rock, and Sticky Web end for the target's side, and the effects of Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Stealth Rock, and Sticky Web end for the user's side. Ignores a target's substitute, although a substitute will still block the lowering of evasiveness.

description: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Protect, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

name: Disable

Fails if one of the target's moves is already disabled, if the target has not made a move, if the target no longer knows the move, or if the move was a Z-Move. Z-Powered moves can still be selected and executed during this effect.

name: Dizzy Punch
description: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

description: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.
shortDescription: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

name: Dragon Rage
description: Deals 40 HP of damage to the target.
shortDescription: Deals 40 HP of damage to the target.

name: Egg Bomb

name: Electric Terrain
description: For 5 turns, the terrain becomes Electric Terrain. During the effect, the power of Electric-type attacks made by grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 1.5 and grounded Pokemon cannot fall asleep; Pokemon already asleep do not wake up. Grounded Pokemon cannot become affected by Yawn or fall asleep from its effect. Camouflage transforms the user into an Electric type, Nature Power becomes Thunderbolt, and Secret Power has a 30% chance to cause paralysis. Fails if the current terrain is Electric Terrain.

name: Embargo
description: For 5 turns, the target's held item has no effect. An item's effect of causing forme changes is unaffected, but any other effects from such items are negated. During the effect, Fling and Natural Gift are prevented from being used by the target. Items thrown at the target with Fling will still activate for it. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain unable to use items.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, the target's item has no effect.

name: Encore
description: For its next 3 turns, the target is forced to repeat its last move used. If the affected move runs out of PP, the effect ends. Fails if the target is already under this effect, if it has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, or if the move is Assist, Copycat, Encore, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, Transform, or any Z-Move. Z-Powered moves can still be selected and executed during this effect.

name: Endure
description: The user will survive attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn with at least 1 HP. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Protect, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

name: Entrainment
description: Causes the target's Ability to become the same as the user's. Fails if the target's Ability is Battle Bond, Comatose, Disguise, Multitype, Power Construct, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Truant, or Zen Mode, or the same Ability as the user, or if the user's Ability is Battle Bond, Comatose, Disguise, Flower Gift, Forecast, Illusion, Imposter, Multitype, Power Construct, Power of Alchemy, Receiver, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Trace, or Zen Mode.

name: Fairy Lock
description: Prevents all active Pokemon from switching next turn. A Pokemon can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Parting Shot, U-turn, or Volt Switch. Fails if the effect is already active.

name: Feint Attack
description: This move does not check accuracy.
shortDescription: This move does not check accuracy.

name: Flame Burst
description: If this move is successful, the target's ally loses 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, unless it has the Magic Guard Ability.

name: Flash
description: Lowers the target's accuracy by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Lowers the target's accuracy by 1.

name: Foresight
description: As long as the target remains active, its evasiveness stat stage is ignored during accuracy checks against it if it is greater than 0, and Normal- and Fighting-type attacks can hit the target if it is a Ghost type. Fails if the target is already affected, or affected by Miracle Eye or Odor Sleuth.
shortDescription: Fighting, Normal hit Ghost. Evasiveness ignored.

name: Frustration
description: Power is equal to the greater of ((255 - user's Happiness) * 2/5), rounded down, or 1.
shortDescription: Max 102 power at minimum Happiness.

name: Gastro Acid
description: Causes the target's Ability to be rendered ineffective as long as it remains active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain under this effect. If the target's Ability is Battle Bond, Comatose, Disguise, Multitype, Power Construct, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, or Zen Mode, this move fails, and receiving the effect through Baton Pass ends the effect immediately.

name: Grass Whistle
description: Causes the target to fall asleep.
shortDescription: Causes the target to fall asleep.

name: Grassy Terrain
description: For 5 turns, the terrain becomes Grassy Terrain. During the effect, the power of Grass-type attacks used by grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 1.5, the power of Bulldoze, Earthquake, and Magnitude used against grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 0.5, and grounded Pokemon have 1/16 of their maximum HP, rounded down, restored at the end of each turn, including the last turn. Camouflage transforms the user into a Grass type, Nature Power becomes Energy Ball, and Secret Power has a 30% chance to cause sleep. Fails if the current terrain is Grassy Terrain.

name: Gravity
description: For 5 turns, the evasiveness of all active Pokemon is multiplied by 0.6. At the time of use, Bounce, Fly, Magnet Rise, Sky Drop, and Telekinesis end immediately for all active Pokemon. During the effect, Bounce, Fly, Flying Press, High Jump Kick, Jump Kick, Magnet Rise, Sky Drop, Splash, and Telekinesis are prevented from being used by all active Pokemon. Ground-type attacks, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Sticky Web, and the Arena Trap Ability can affect Flying types or Pokemon with the Levitate Ability. Fails if this move is already in effect. Relevant Z-Powered moves can still be selected, but will be prevented at execution during this effect.

name: Growth
description: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage. If the weather is Sunny Day or Desolate Land, this move raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages.

name: Heal Bell
description: Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of its non-volatile status condition. Active Pokemon with the Soundproof Ability are not cured.

name: Heal Block
description: For 5 turns, the target is prevented from restoring any HP as long as it remains active. During the effect, healing and draining moves are unusable, and Abilities and items that grant healing will not heal the user. If an affected Pokemon uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain unable to restore its HP. Pain Split and the Regenerator Ability are unaffected. Relevant Z-Powered moves can still be selected and executed during this effect.

name: Healing Wish
description: The user faints and the Pokemon brought out to replace it has its HP fully restored along with having any non-volatile status condition cured. The new Pokemon is sent out at the end of the turn, and the healing happens before hazards take effect. Fails if the user is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party.
shortDescription: User faints. Replacement is fully healed.

name: Heal Order
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half up.

name: Howl

shortDescription: Raises the user's Attack by 1.

name: Hurricane

If the weather is Primordial Sea or Rain Dance, this move does not check accuracy. If the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, this move's accuracy is 50%.

name: Hyper Fang
description: Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
shortDescription: 10% chance to make the target flinch.

name: Hyperspace Fury

If this move is successful, it breaks through the target's Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, or Spiky Shield for this turn, allowing other Pokemon to attack the target normally. If the target's side is protected by Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard, that protection is also broken for this turn and other Pokemon may attack the target's side normally.
shortDescription: Hoopa-U: Lowers user's Def by 1; breaks protect.

name: Hyperspace Hole
description: If this move is successful, it breaks through the target's Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, or Spiky Shield for this turn, allowing other Pokemon to attack the target normally. If the target's side is protected by Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard, that protection is also broken for this turn and other Pokemon may attack the target's side normally.
shortDescription: Breaks the target's protection for this turn.

name: Ice Ball
description: If this move is successful, the user is locked into this move and cannot make another move until it misses, 5 turns have passed, or the attack cannot be used. Power doubles with each successful hit of this move and doubles again if Defense Curl was used previously by the user. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn. If this move hits an active Disguise during the effect, the power multiplier is paused but the turn counter is not, potentially allowing the multiplier to be used on the user's next move after this effect ends.

name: Ice Hammer
description: Lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Lowers the user's Speed by 1.

name: Infestation
description: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Parting Shot, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

The user can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass, Parting Shot, U-turn, or Volt Switch. During the effect, the user can be hit normally by Ground-type attacks and be affected by Spikes, Toxic Spikes, and Sticky Web, even if the user is a Flying type or has the Levitate Ability.

Fails if the target has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, if the target is preparing to use Beak Blast, Focus Punch, or Shell Trap, or if the move is Assist, Beak Blast, Belch, Bide, Celebrate, Copycat, Focus Punch, Ice Ball, Instruct, King's Shield, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Outrage, Petal Dance, Rollout, Shell Trap, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, Thrash, Transform, Uproar, any two-turn move, any recharge move, or any Z-Move.

name: King's Shield

Non-damaging moves go through this protection. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Protect, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

shortDescription: Copies a foe at 1.5x power. User must be faster.

name: Metronome
description: A random move is selected for use, other than After You, Assist, Baneful Bunker, Beak Blast, Belch, Bestow, Celebrate, Chatter, Copycat, Counter, Covet, Crafty Shield, Destiny Bond, Detect, Diamond Storm, Dragon Ascent, Endure, Feint, Fleur Cannon, Focus Punch, Follow Me, Freeze Shock, Helping Hand, Hold Hands, Hyperspace Fury, Hyperspace Hole, Ice Burn, Instruct, King's Shield, Light of Ruin, Mat Block, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mind Blown, Mirror Coat, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Origin Pulse, Photon Geyser, Plasma Fists, Precipice Blades, Protect, Quash, Quick Guard, Rage Powder, Relic Song, Secret Sword, Shell Trap, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Snarl, Snatch, Snore, Spectral Thief, Spiky Shield, Spotlight, Steam Eruption, Struggle, Switcheroo, Techno Blast, Thief, Thousand Arrows, Thousand Waves, Transform, Trick, V-create, or Wide Guard.

name: Miracle Eye
description: As long as the target remains active, its evasiveness stat stage is ignored during accuracy checks against it if it is greater than 0, and Psychic-type attacks can hit the target if it is a Dark type. Fails if the target is already affected, or affected by Foresight or Odor Sleuth.
shortDescription: Psychic hits Dark. Evasiveness ignored.

name: Mirror Move
description: The user uses the last move used by the target. The copied move is used against that target, if possible. Fails if the target has not made a move, or if the last move used cannot be copied by this move.
shortDescription: User uses the target's last used move against it.

name: Mirror Shot
description: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's accuracy by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 30% chance to lower the target's accuracy by 1.

name: Moonlight
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP if Delta Stream or no weather conditions are in effect, 2/3 of its maximum HP if the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, and 1/4 of its maximum HP if the weather is Hail, Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, or Sandstorm, all rounded half down.

name: Morning Sun
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP if Delta Stream or no weather conditions are in effect, 2/3 of its maximum HP if the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, and 1/4 of its maximum HP if the weather is Hail, Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, or Sandstorm, all rounded half down.

name: Mud Bomb
description: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's accuracy by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 30% chance to lower the target's accuracy by 1.

name: Mud Sport
description: For 5 turns, all Electric-type attacks used by any active Pokemon have their power multiplied by 0.33. Fails if this effect is already active.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, Electric-type attacks have 1/3 power.

name: Multi-Attack
description: This move's type depends on the user's held Memory.
shortDescription: Type varies based on the held Memory.

name: Natural Gift
description: The type and power of this move depend on the user's held Berry, and the Berry is lost. Fails if the user is not holding a Berry, if the user has the Klutz Ability, or if Embargo or Magic Room is in effect for the user.
shortDescription: Power and type depends on the user's Berry.

name: Needle Arm
description: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
shortDescription: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

name: Nightmare
description: Causes the target to lose 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn as long as it is asleep. This move does not affect the target unless it is asleep. The effect ends when the target wakes up, even if it falls asleep again in the same turn.
shortDescription: A sleeping target is hurt by 1/4 max HP per turn.

name: Odor Sleuth
description: As long as the target remains active, its evasiveness stat stage is ignored during accuracy checks against it if it is greater than 0, and Normal- and Fighting-type attacks can hit the target if it is a Ghost type. Fails if the target is already affected, or affected by Foresight or Miracle Eye.
shortDescription: Fighting, Normal hit Ghost. Evasiveness ignored.

name: Ominous Wind
description: Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 10% chance to raise all stats by 1 (not acc/eva).

name: Powder
description: If the target uses a Fire-type move this turn, it is prevented from executing and the target loses 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded half up. This effect does not happen if the Fire-type move is prevented by Primordial Sea.
shortDescription: If using a Fire move, target loses 1/4 max HP.

name: Protect
description: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Protect, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

name: Psychic Terrain
description: For 5 turns, the terrain becomes Psychic Terrain. During the effect, the power of Psychic-type attacks made by grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 1.5 and grounded Pokemon cannot be hit by moves with priority greater than 0, unless the target is an ally. Camouflage transforms the user into a Psychic type, Nature Power becomes Psychic, and Secret Power has a 30% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage. Fails if the current terrain is Psychic Terrain.

name: Psycho Boost
description: Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.
shortDescription: Lowers the user's Sp. Atk by 2.

name: Psywave
description: Deals damage to the target equal to (user's level) * (X + 50) / 100, where X is a random number from 0 to 100, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: Random damage equal to 0.5x-1.5x user's level.

name: Punishment
description: Power is equal to 60+(X*20), where X is the target's total stat stage changes that are greater than 0, but not more than 200 power.
shortDescription: 60 power +20 for each of the target's stat boosts.

name: Pursuit
description: If an adjacent opposing Pokemon switches out this turn, this move hits that Pokemon before it leaves the field, even if it was not the original target. If the user moves after an opponent using Parting Shot, U-turn, or Volt Switch, but not Baton Pass, it will hit that opponent before it leaves the field. Power doubles and no accuracy check is done if the user hits an opponent switching out, and the user's turn is over; if an opponent faints from this, the replacement Pokemon does not become active until the end of the turn.

name: Quick Guard
description: The user and its party members are protected from attacks with original or altered priority greater than 0 made by other Pokemon, including allies, during this turn. This move modifies the same 1/X chance of being successful used by other protection moves, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used, but does not use the chance to check for failure. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Protect, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn or if this move is already in effect for the user's side.

name: Rage
description: Once this move is successfully used, the user's Attack is raised by 1 stage every time it is hit by another Pokemon's attack as long as this move is chosen for use.
shortDescription: Raises the user's Attack by 1 if hit during use.

name: Rapid Spin
description: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the effects of Leech Seed and binding moves end for the user, and all hazards are removed from the user's side of the field.
shortDescription: Frees user from hazards, binding, Leech Seed.

name: Razor Wind
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.
shortDescription: Charges, then hits foe(s) turn 2. High crit ratio.

name: Recycle
description: The user regains the item it last used. Fails if the user is holding an item, if the user has not held an item, if the item was a popped Air Balloon, if the item was picked up by a Pokemon with the Pickup Ability, or if the item was lost to Bug Bite, Covet, Incinerate, Knock Off, Pluck, or Thief. Items thrown with Fling can be regained.

name: Refresh
description: The user cures its burn, poison, or paralysis. Fails if the user is not burned, poisoned, or paralyzed.
shortDescription: User cures its burn, poison, or paralysis.

name: Relic Song
description: Has a 10% chance to cause the target to fall asleep. If this move is successful on at least one target and the user is a Meloetta, it changes to Pirouette Forme if it is currently in Aria Forme, or changes to Aria Forme if it is currently in Pirouette Forme. This forme change does not happen if the Meloetta has the Sheer Force Ability. The Pirouette Forme reverts to Aria Forme when Meloetta is not active.
shortDescription: 10% chance to sleep foe(s). Meloetta transforms.

name: Return
description: Power is equal to the greater of (user's Happiness * 2/5), rounded down, or 1.
shortDescription: Max 102 power at maximum Happiness.

name: Revelation Dance
description: This move's type depends on the user's primary type. If the user's primary type is typeless, this move's type is the user's secondary type if it has one, otherwise the added type from Forest's Curse or Trick-or-Treat. This move is typeless if the user's type is typeless alone.
shortDescription: Type varies based on the user's primary type.

name: Rock Climb
description: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.
shortDescription: 20% chance to confuse the target.

name: Role Play
